alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Mobile Central; Mobile Coastal; Mobile Inland (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 3:15AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mobile, Baldwin and northwestern Escambia Counties through 400 AM CST... At 315 AM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles west of Uriah to 3 miles northwest of Wilmer to 4 miles northwest of Escatawpa to 6 miles southeast of Gulf Park Estates. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Midtown Mobile, Prichard, Daphne, Tillmans Corner, Fairhope, Saraland, Bay Minette, Theodore, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Grand Bay, Robertsdale, Bayou La Batre, Creola, Loxley, Chunchula, Stockton, Stapleton, Gulfcrest and Axis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Central; Mobile Central; Mobile Coastal; Mobile Inland
